Split a Rmd or Qmd file into a tibble and vice-versa

statnmap

2021-01-23

Source: vignettes/z-split-a-rmd-or-qmd-file-into-a-tibble-and-vice-versa.Rmd
z-split-a-rmd-or-qmd-file-into-a-tibble-and-vice-versa.Rmd
library(lightparser)

Parse and split a Rmd / Qmd file, and transform as tibble

This is the core of {fusen}. Where everything starts.
{fusen} reads your flat file to detect what is a yaml header, what is a code chunk and its options, what is a text part.
Function split_to_tbl() returns a tibble with all these parts.

You’re not supposed to use this function directly when working with {fusen}. However, since {parsermd} is not maintained anymore, you may be interested in having access to these core functions.

file <- system.file(
  "dev-template-parsing.Rmd",
  package = "lightparser"
)
split_to_tbl(file)
#> It seems you are currently knitting a Rmd/Qmd file. The parsing of the file will be done in a new R session.
#> # A tibble: 35 × 6
#>    type    label       params           text         code       heading         
#>    <chr>   <chr>       <list>           <named list> <list>     <chr>           
#>  1 yaml    NA          <named list [5]> <lgl [1]>    <lgl [1]>  NA              
#>  2 inline  NA          <lgl [1]>        <chr [0]>    <lgl [1]>  NA              
#>  3 block   development <named list [2]> <lgl [1]>    <chr [1]>  NA              
#>  4 inline  NA          <lgl [1]>        <chr [2]>    <lgl [1]>  NA              
#>  5 heading NA          <lgl [1]>        <chr [1]>    <lgl [1]>  Description of …
#>  6 inline  NA          <lgl [1]>        <chr [3]>    <lgl [1]>  NA              
#>  7 block   description <named list [1]> <lgl [1]>    <chr [13]> NA              
#>  8 inline  NA          <lgl [1]>        <chr [1]>    <lgl [1]>  NA              
#>  9 heading NA          <lgl [1]>        <chr [1]>    <lgl [1]>  Read data       
#> 10 inline  NA          <lgl [1]>        <chr [5]>    <lgl [1]>  NA              
#> # ℹ 25 more rows

combine_tbl_to_file 

file <- system.file("dev-template-parsing.Rmd",
  package = "lightparser"
)
tbl_rmd <- split_to_tbl(file)
#> It seems you are currently knitting a Rmd/Qmd file. The parsing of the file will be done in a new R session.
combine_tbl_to_file(tbl_rmd, tempfile(fileext = ".Rmd"))
#> [1] "---\ntitle: dev_history.Rmd for working package\noutput: html_document\nauthor: statnmap\ndate: '2023-10-12'\neditor_options:\n  chunk_output_type: console\n---\n\n\n```{r development}\n#| include: no\n\nlibrary(testthat)\n```\n\n\n<!--\n# Description of your package\n\nThis will fill the description of your package.\n-->\n```{r description}\n# --> for parse tests\nfusen::fill_description(\n    pkg = here::here(),\n    fields = list(\n        Title = \"Build A Package From Rmarkdown file\",\n        Description = \"Use Rmarkdown First method to build your package. dataset\nfile.copy(system.file(\"nyc_squirrels_sample.csv\", package = \"fusen\"), here::here(\"inst\"))\n```\n\n\n# Calculate the median of a vector\n\nHere is some inline R code : `r 1+1`\n```{r function}\n#' My median\n#'\n#' @param x Vector of Numeric values\n#' @inheritParams stats::median\n#'\n#' @return\n#' Median of vector x\n#' @export\n#'\n#' @examples\n#' my_median(2:20)\nmy_median <- function(x, na.rm = TRUE) {\n    if (!is.numeric(x)) {\n        stop(\"x should be numeric\")\n    }\n    stats::median(x, na.rm = na.rm)\n}\n```\n\n\n```{r examples}\nmy_median(1:12)\n```\n\n\n```{r tests}\ntest_that(\"my_median works properly and show error if needed\", {\n    expect_error(my_median(\"text\"))\n})\n```\n\n\n# Calculate the mean of a vector\n## Use sub-functions in the same chunk\n```{r function-1}\n#| filename: the_median_file\n\n#' My Other median\n#'\n#' @param x Vector of Numeric values\n#' @inheritParams stats::median\n#'\n#' @return\n#' Median of vector x\n#' @export\n#'\n#' @examples\nmy_other_median <- function(x, na.rm = TRUE) {\n    if (!is.numeric(x)) {\n        stop(\"x should be numeric\")\n    }\n    sub_median(x, na.rm = na.rm)\n}\n\n#' Core of the median not exported\n#' @param x Vector of Numeric values\n#' @inheritParams stats::median\nsub_median <- function(x, na.rm = TRUE) {\n    stats::median(x, na.rm)\n}\n```\n\n\n```{r examples-1}\nmy_other_median(1:12)\nmy_other_median(8:20)\nmy_other_median(20:50)\n```\n\n\n```{r tests-1}\ntest_that(\"my_median works properly and show error if needed\", {\n    expect_true(my_other_median(1:12) == 6.5)\n    expect_error(my_other_median(\"text\"))\n})\n```\n\n\n```\nnot a R chunk that should be kept in vignette, but not in code\n```\n\n```{r development-1}\n#| eval: no\n\n# Run but keep eval=FALSE to avoid infinite loop\n# Execute in the console directly\nfusen::inflate(flat_file = \"dev/dev_history.Rmd\")\n```\n\n\n\n# Inflate your package\n```{r}\n# duplicate empty name\n```\n\n\n```{r}\n# duplicate empty name\n```\n\n\n\nYou're one inflate from paper to box.\nBuild your package from this very Rmd using `fusen::inflate()`\n\n-
